name: Wooden Pickaxe
description: An old pickaxe, made of trusty oak, held together by loosely knotted rope.

name: Stone Pickaxe
description: A slightly less worn, and sturdier pickaxe. Made of rock harvested from nearby cliff sides.

name: Imperfect Iron Pickaxe
description: An ameteurs work to be sure, yet a tool that works well for mining.

name: Strong Iron Pickaxe
description: Forged by an experienced blacksmith, this pickaxe can strike stone with no issue.

name: Steel Pickaxe
description: A masterfully made bit of equipment, known as the industry standard for your job.

name: Diamond Pickaxe
description: A valuable tool, often lasting those who utilize them 'til the end of their days.

name: Manyllyn Pickaxe
description: Crafted by those in the upper most echelon of metalsmiths.

name: Basic Drill
description: Ususally utilized for business mining operations, this tool is a force to be reckoned with.

name: High Powered Drill
description: Approaching the quarry, you can feel the rocks tremble in fear from the power of this drill.
